message.content:
The most likely category for this paper is "Books" because it is discussing a book about creating story and characters for animated features and shorts. 

The second most likely category is "Movies & TV" because the book is specifically about animation, which falls under the realm of movies and television.

The third most likely category is "Arts, Crafts & Sewing" because the book is about the artistic process of creating animation.

The fourth most likely category is "Toys & Games" because animation is often associated with toys and games, and the book may be of interest to those in the toy and game industry.

The fifth most likely category is "Office Products" because the book may be useful for animation students and schools, which would fall under the realm of office products.

prompt:
Title: Prepare to Board! Creating Story and Characters for Animated Features and Shorts: 2nd Edition
Content: 'Nancy Beiman has done an excellent job explaining the story development and boarding process, and I am certain this book will be a useful tool to all animation students and schools.'Brian P. McEntee, Art Director 'Beauty and the Beast' and Production Designer 'Ice Age''No one knows more about designing characters and creating story for animation than Nancy Beiman. Lavishly illustrated and expertly written, she draws on all her experience as a teacher, an artist and an animation industry veteran...
